Posts.Content: momslilgirl wrote: Just thought I would keep everyone posted. A week or so ago I fist posted on advice on what to do with the possibility that my moms cancer was spreading. Now yesterday we got told that it has spread to lymphnodes in neck, a spot in the bones that look "suspicios" and Brain mets. "Very small" was thw word the onc said. He's putting her on a regiman of 5 radiation treatments to the brain. Then Chemo, Herceptin then a drip of some kind. He also told her she can't drive until the brain mets dissapear. Can't really say we saw any of this coming. I wanted to ask those who know more than I do if she has a possibility of coming out of this? Can people have remission if there is brain mets? I know ever cancer patient is unique, just I'm looking for truth and I'm really scared. Thanks for reading :) Manda Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: my mom now has Brain mets momslilgirl JeninMichigan

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2012 06:06PM momslilgirl wrote: Kick its BUTT! Fighters win darlin, fighters win! You may cancer but don't let cancer have you! I'm sure you've heard all of it before but it really has to do with your mind set, try and stay positive... I know its hard :(My payers are with you!
Posts.Title: It's Baaaack!!! Cathy2 alesta29

Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2012 09:54PM momslilgirl wrote: I get a lot of "how's ur Mom?". And I know there asking because it the "polite" thing to do but at the same timei just want to scream " she's gonna die! That's how she's doing....how's your day going?" I get that ppl don't understand and its a rarity that I come across someone who has a similar life. My mom actually has a bit of a sense of humor about it. She has a cronic cough that gets really bad and when she has a coughing fit out in public and ppl stare she'll respond " don't worry its cancer, its not contagious" which catches ppl off guard but it the truth right? I really hate cancer though...I truly wish ppl didn't have to ask or make comments about how ppl "look".
Posts.Title: I was rude ma111 katie31

Posts.Content: momslilgirl wrote: Can anyone tell me their Journey with this disease? I'm just gathing some info for my family. Its nice to know real stories rather then just reading about statistics online. Thank you so much...you all are such a big help and insperation. P.S my mom is diagnosed Stage 4 09/2008 mets to nodes under arm and right lung. ER+, HER2+/- Progression small, going in for PET and head to toe CT this week and gets results in 2 weeks time. Manda Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Stage IV Journeys momslilgirl scuttlers

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2012 12:57PM momslilgirl wrote: Hmmm, I guess that's a difficult word. My family sometimes calls cancer " the ride" full of up, downs, turns...I guess we like metaphors. Lol. Thank you Ann, I did check out your Blog, very insperational, my mom and I are grateful you take the time to write it. As a child of cancer it's nice to know ppl are LIVING with the disease and fighting as hard as they can.
Posts.Title: Stage IV Journeys momslilgirl scuttlers
